title: In T.N., where dengue cases hit 26,000 this year, tracking every case, forecasting outbreaks is helping prevent deaths - The Hindu
summary:
Dengue Cases Surge in Tamil Nadu: Effective Surveillance and Forecasting Help Prevent Deaths

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu has recorded over 26,000 cases of dengue this year. Public health officials have implemented improved surveillance and reporting systems to manage outbreaks effectively and prevent deaths.

  • As of December 26, Tamil Nadu recorded 26,740 dengue cases and 13 deaths.
  • Surveillance has allowed for better identification and reporting of cases, preventing mortality.
  • Dengue cases have been reported throughout the year, with increased incidence during the monsoon season.
  • The highest number of cases since 2012, with a comparison to previous years detailing cases and deaths.
“So, while the initial rise in cases was manageable, we stepped up surveillance to ensure that no case went unreported.” - T. S. Selvavinayagam, Director of Public Health and Preventive Medicine.

The proactive measures in Tamil Nadu have shown a significant impact on managing dengue outbreaks and protecting public health effectively.
newTitle: Dengue Cases Surge in Tamil Nadu: Effective Surveillance and Forecasting Help Prevent Deaths

title: NASA confirms Parker Solar Probe made close approach to the Sun - Euronews
summary:
NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

Date: Latest Update

Source: NASA

The Parker Solar Probe has successfully made the closest approach to the Sun, setting a record by coming within six million kilometers of the Sun's surface.

  • The probe passed through the Sun's outer atmosphere, known as the corona.
  • It achieved speeds of 690,000 kph during its close approach.
  • The heat shield of the Parker can withstand temperatures reaching up to 1,370 degrees Celsius.
  • This mission aims to provide insights into the reasons behind the Sun's corona being significantly hotter than its surface.
  • Parker Solar Probe was launched in 2018 and is expected to continue orbiting the Sun until at least September.
“Parker Solar Probe was developed as part of NASA’s Living With a Star program to explore aspects of the Sun-Earth system that directly affect life and society,” said NASA in a statement.

This successful mission is a significant step in understanding solar phenomena and their impact on Earth.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

title: World rapid & blitz: Carlsen walks out of tournament after dress code breach - Hindustan Times
summary:
Carlsen Exits Rapid & Blitz Tournament Over Dress Code Violation

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen walked out of the World Rapid and Blitz Tournament in New York after he refused to comply with dress code regulations. After being fined for wearing jeans, Carlsen opted to leave the tournament instead of changing his attire.

  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans, which are prohibited by FIDE regulations.
  • He was not paired for round nine after refusing to change his clothes.
  • Carlsen expressed his frustration, stating it became a matter of principle for him.
  • Another player, Ian Nepomniachtchi, complied with the dress code after being fined.
“Honestly, I’m too old at this point to care too much... Probably I’ll head off to somewhere where the weather is a bit nicer than here.” - Magnus Carlsen

Carlsen's exit has raised eyebrows in the chess community, emphasizing ongoing tensions between players and FIDE regarding regulations and player rights.
newTitle: Carlsen Exits Rapid & Blitz Tournament Over Dress Code Violation

title: BRS Leader KTR Summoned By Probe Agency In Formula E Racing Case - NDTV
summary:
BRS Leader KTR Summoned By Probe Agency In Formula E Racing Case

Publication Date: January 2024

Source: New Delhi

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned BRS leader and former Telangana minister KT Rama Rao regarding financial irregularities tied to the Formula E race in Hyderabad.

  • KTR is scheduled to appear on January 7, with other officials on January 2 and 3.
  • Allegations involve unauthorized transfers totaling Rs 55 crore from the HMDA to Formula E Operations Limited.
  • Additional transfers of Rs 54.8 crore for future races are under investigation.
  • This is the second money laundering case related to the family of former Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao.
This marks another political and legal challenge for the BRS party.

The unfolding events signal potential repercussions for the BRS party amidst ongoing scrutiny.
newTitle: BRS Leader KTR Summoned By Probe Agency In Formula E Racing Case

title: Govt agreed to memorial for Manmohan Singh, Congress now playing politics: BJP - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Accuses Congress of Playing Politics Over Memorial for Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has announced its decision to construct a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh while accusing the Congress party of politicizing the issue.

  • The BJP stated that it is committed to honoring Manmohan Singh’s contributions to India's economic development.
  • A memorial and mausoleum will be built in his memory, a decision that was communicated to Congress leadership prior.
  • The Congress has claimed it wanted Manmohan Singh's cremation to take place at a location suitable for a memorial, but the ceremony occurred at Nigambodh Ghat.
  • BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized Congress for their perceived lack of respect towards Singh.
“Congress party, who never respected Dr. Manmohan Singh in their lifetime, today even after his death, they are seen doing politics.” - Sudhanshu Trivedi

The BJP insists that the memorial will be built following necessary legal protocols, reinforcing their commitment to respecting Singh's legacy.
newTitle: BJP Accuses Congress of Playing Politics Over Memorial for Manmohan Singh

title: "Could Have Got Him Out 6-7 Times In 2 Overs": Jasprit Bumrah's Blunt Take On Sam Konstas With Whom .. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Reflects on Challenging Clash with Sam Konstas During Fourth Test

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent Test match against Australia, Jasprit Bumrah discussed his experience facing debutant Sam Konstas, expressing confidence in his abilities despite Konstas's impressive performance.

  • Bumrah felt he could have dismissed Konstas several times in the early overs.
  • Konstas played aggressively, scoring 60 runs with two sixes off Bumrah.
  • This marked the first time in three years Bumrah was scored against with a six in Test cricket.
  • Bumrah reflected on the unpredictable nature of cricket, emphasizing that performance can vary from day to day.
  • He praised the challenges of playing in Australia, highlighting the testing conditions for bowlers.
  • Bumrah acknowledged the talent of Australian batsman Steve Smith, describing him as a challenging opponent.
Bumrah stated, "Initially I felt I could have got him out 6-7 times in the first two overs but that's how cricket goes. Some days it pays off, some days it doesn't."

Overall, Bumrah's insights shed light on the dynamics of international cricket, particularly in high-pressure situations against young talents like Konstas.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Reflects on Challenging Clash with Sam Konstas During Fourth Test

title: ‘Utter rubbish…’: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha slams Congress amid Manmohan Singh memorial row - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over Memorial Controversy for Manmohan Singh

Date: Dec 28, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of former president Pranab Mukherjee, criticized the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting after her father’s death in 2020, while supporting a request for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Sharmistha stated the Congress didn’t hold a CWC meeting after Pranab Mukherjee's passing.
  • She referenced diary entries showing that a CWC meeting was held for K.R. Narayanan's passing.
  • Despite criticism, she supports a memorial for Manmohan Singh, who passed away at 92.
“When baba passed away, Congress didnt even bother 2 call CWC 4 condolence meeting. That’s utter rubbish...” - Sharmistha Mukherjee

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s remarks highlight ongoing tensions within the Congress party regarding how it honors its leaders, contrasted with her support for a memorial for Manmohan Singh.
newTitle: Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over Memorial Controversy for Manmohan Singh

summary:

Date: Dec 28, 2024 08:56 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the internal conflict within Trump's support base regarding H-1B visas for skilled workers, highlighting his alignment with Silicon Valley supporters against the anti-immigration stance of MAGA proponents.

  • Trump favors a more open high-skilled immigration policy, siding with Silicon Valley.

  • Trump’s allies, Musk and Ramaswamy, defend the H-1B program against MAGA criticisms.
  • Concerns about the impact of H-1B visas on American jobs and racial undertones in the debate.
"OF COURSE my companies and I would prefer to hire Americans and we DO, as that is MUCH easier than going through the incredibly painful and slow work visa process. HOWEVER, there is a dire shortage of extremely talented and motivated engineers in America." - Elon Musk

title: Azerbaijani and U.S. officials suggest plane that crashed may have been hit by weapons fire - The Hindu
summary:
Azerbaijani and U.S. officials suggest plane that crashed may have been hit by weapons fire

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The article discusses the crash of an Azerbaijani airliner, suggesting that Russian air defense systems may have caused the incident.

  • The plane crashed on December 25, 2024, killing 38 people and injuring 29 others.
  • A U.S. official stated there were indications that the jet was downed by Russian air defenses.
  • Azerbaijan's Minister of Digital Development pointed out potential external impacts as per preliminary expert conclusions.
  • Survivors described loud noises and explosions before the crash, indicating possible weapon discharge.
  • Azerbaijan Airlines has blamed the crash on “physical and technical interference.”
  • Investigations are ongoing with teams examining the crash site in Grozny.
“If it’s proven that the plane crashed after being hit by Russian air defenses, it would be the second deadly civil aviation accident linked to fighting in Ukraine.”

The incident raises significant concerns over air safety in conflict regions and the impact of military actions on civilian aviation.
newTitle: Azerbaijani and U.S. officials suggest plane that crashed may have been hit by weapons fire

title: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen announces shock withdrawal; Arjun, Harika, Humpy among leaders after Day 2 - ESPN India
summary:
Carlsen Withdraws from 2024 FIDE World Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Controversy

Published on: Dec 28, 2024, Source: ESPN

Magnus Carlsen has withdrawn from the World Rapid & Blitz Championships due to a dress code issue, leading to a reshuffle in the leaderboard where Arjun Erigaisi, Harika Dronavalli, and Koneru Humpy emerge as leaders.

Key Points

  • Carlsen faced a $200 fine and refused to change attire, resulting in his withdrawal.
  • Volodar Murzin leads the Open championship, followed closely by Arjun Erigaisi and others.
  • Harika Dronavalli and Koneru Humpy topped the Women's division after eight rounds.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE, stating a desire to distance himself from the organization.
"I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them." - Magnus Carlsen

FIDE responded by emphasizing the need for adherence to established dress code regulations for professionalism.

Conclusion

The incident has sparked discussions around player treatment and organizational policies in professional chess.
newTitle: Carlsen Withdraws from 2024 FIDE World Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Controversy

title: ‘Baby John’ box office collection Day 3: Varun Dhawan starrer misses Rs 20 crore mark as collections fall - TOI Etimes
summary:
‘Baby John’ Box Office Collection Day 3: Varun Dhawan's Film Struggles to Reach Rs 20 Crore

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times of India

After a lukewarm start, Varun Dhawan’s film Baby John has continued to drop in box office performance, recording just Rs 3.65 crore on its first Friday, which has raised concerns regarding its future collections.

  • The film started with Rs 11.25 crore but fell sharply by 57.8% to Rs 4.75 crore on the second day.
  • Its total collection now stands at Rs 19.65 crore, just missing the Rs 20 crore mark.
  • It was produced on a budget of Rs 160 crore with projections suggesting a lifetime collection of only Rs 50 crore.
  • The movie faces stiff competition from other releases like Pushpa 2 and Mufasa: The Lion King.
  • Directed by Kalees, it is a Hindi remake of the Tamil film Theri.
“Industry watchers will be closely monitoring the weekend collections to determine if Baby John can recover from its slow start.”

Overall, the film’s disappointing performance in its opening days may challenge its ability to break even, making the upcoming weekend critical for improving its box office standing.
newTitle: ‘Baby John’ Box Office Collection Day 3: Varun Dhawan's Film Struggles to Reach Rs 20 Crore

title: Blood may explain loss of hair: Experts explain an overlooked health aspect - South First
Just one session of exercise can keep your brain supercharged till the next day - The Times of India
summary:
Just One Session of Exercise Can Supercharge Your Brain Until the Next Day

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

A recent study by University College London reveals that only one session of exercise can enhance memory benefits for over 24 hours. This emphasizes the importance of physical activity not just for physical health, but also for cognitive enhancement.

  • The study involved 76 participants aged 50 to 83 engaging in moderate to vigorous physical activity.
  • Memory tests showed improved performance the day after exercising.
  • Participants reported less sitting time and more deep sleep, contributing to memory improvement.
  • This research uses a unique “micro-longitudinal” study design, tracking daily activities of participants.
  • Findings were published in the International Journal of Behavioral Nutrition and Physical Activity.
“Our findings suggest that the short-term memory benefits of physical activity may last longer than previously thought, possibly to the next day instead of just the few hours after exercise,” Dr. Mikaela Bloomberg stated.

This research underscores the cognitive benefits derived from regular physical activity and highlights the need for mindful incorporation of exercise into daily routines.
newTitle: Just One Session of Exercise Can Supercharge Your Brain Until the Next Day
